definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The Lord stretched out His arms, and I saw His nail-pierced hands.
sentences.chinese: 主伸出他的臂膀，我看到他那钉痕的双手。

sentences.english: She returned to the hearth, and frankly extended her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她又回到炉边，坦率地伸出她的手。

sentences.english: I tripped over the leg that stuck out.
sentences.chinese: 我被什么人伸出腿绊了一跤。

sentences.english: Dozens of hoses snaked through open doors or holes in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 从门洞和墙洞里伸出许多水管，盘绕散落。

sentences.english: There was much jerking of heads, and looking down the line.
sentences.chinese: 常常有人伸出头来，望望后面的队伍。

sentences.english: He stretched and shook with me.
sentences.chinese: 他伸出手和我握了握手。

sentences.english: The balcony juts out over the garden.
She nearly fell down by stumbling over my stretched leg.
sentences.chinese: 她绊在我伸出的腿上，险些跌倒。
他的额头上伸出了汗珠。

sentences.english: The quiet streets stretched out on either side like the arms of a skeleton.
sentences.chinese: 静静的街道从两旁伸出来，像骷髅伸着枯臂。

sentences.english: Mary has more goodness in her little finger than he has in his whole body.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽伸出一个小指头比他整个人都强。

sentences.english: Mrs. Struthers extended a hail- fellow hand to Archer.
sentences.chinese: 斯特拉瑟斯太太向阿切尔友好地伸出手。

sentences.english: As he looked out, a fantastic smell came to his nose.
sentences.chinese: 当他伸出头时，一股诱人的香味扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: The boy took his mother's outstretched hand.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩抓住妈妈伸出的手。

sentences.english: Bending down, the blind man stretched out his hand and patted the dog's head.
sentences.chinese: 弯下来，这位盲人伸出他的手并拍了拍这条狗的头。

sentences.english: The rock is said to thrust 100 feet above the water.
sentences.chinese: 据说岩石伸出水面100英尺。

definition: to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
